tweets.text: Show your friends how to use @Grok

quoted.text:
Grok Voice mode is insanely capable and it gets better every day

You can talk to Grok naturally and it does real-time web searches, pulls fresh context from ùïè feed, and gives you everything you need to know without you lifting a finger

With Grok Vision, just point your camera at anything and ask ‚ÄúWhat am I looking at?‚Äù ‚Äì Grok analyzes it on the spot and explains it in detail

tweets.text: And this is why we have the first and second amendments in America

quoted.text:
UK: A Brit posted photo of him holding a shotgun while on holiday in Florida, when he returned home UK police arrested him, seized his devices, jailed him overnight for violating the 1986 Public Order Act. The process was the punishment.

After sharing a photo of himself posing with a legally possessed shotgun at a Florida shooting range, a British man was arrested, locked in a cell overnight, interrogated, and lectured that he ‚Äúmust understand how posts make people feel.‚Äù Police seized his computer and phone, wiping out his ability to work. Weeks later, all charges were quietly dropped because they were baseless from the start. Critics say the ordeal proves the UK has turned social media into a surveillance trap where innocent people are punished by process alone.

h/t @Artemisfornow

user.name: @amuse
